name: inculcate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to fix beliefs or ideas in someone's mind, especially by repeating them often: inculcate something in/into someone Our coach has worked hard to inculcate a team spirit in/into the players. Synonym
infuse

Related word
inculcation
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cause someone to have particular beliefs or values by repeating them frequently: The goal is to inculcate in students a tolerance for people of other religions and races.
